senses.de: The place or location where someone or something is.
senses.ex: The position of the house is by the lake.

Tips.title: Physical Placement
Tips.description: Refers to a specific geographic or spatial spot that can often be pinpointed on a map or through coordinates.
Tips.example: Can you mark the position of the café on this map?

Tips.title: Static or Mobile
Tips.description: 'Position' implies a place that might be fixed or can change, such as a moving vehicle.
Tips.example: The tracker shows the current position of the train.

senses.de: A job or role in a company or organization.
senses.ex: I have applied for a new position in the company.

Tips.title: Rank or Function
Tips.description: In a job, 'position' can indicate one's duties or rank within an organization's hierarchy.
Tips.example: She earned the position of manager after years of hard work.

Tips.title: Formal Employment
Tips.description: Usually refers to formal or official job roles as opposed to casual work.
Tips.example: He holds a senior position in the government sector.

senses.de: The way in which someone or something is arranged or placed.
senses.ex: The book is in a vertical position on the shelf.

Tips.title: Physical Orientation
Tips.description: Describes how an object is being held or located in relation to other objects or its surroundings.
Tips.example: The statue's upright position makes it a central focus of the room.

Tips.title: Arranged Set-Up
Tips.description: Can be related to the intentional arrangement of items according to specific criteria or purposes.
Tips.example: For the best sound, position the speakers to face the center of the room.

senses.de: The opinion or attitude that someone has about something.
senses.ex: What's your position on climate change?

Tips.title: Intellectual Stand
Tips.description: Denotes a thought-out stance on a topic, which might involve moral, political, or personal aspects.
Tips.example: Her position on the issue is rooted in her scientific background.

Tips.title: Potential Debate
Tips.description: Usually used in discussions where varying opinions are expected, leading to exchanges or debates.
Tips.example: Let's hear everyone's position before we come to a decision.

senses.de: To put or arrange someone or something in a particular place or way.
senses.ex: Please position the chair in front of the desk.

Tips.title: Intentional Arrangement
Tips.description: Means placing something carefully with a purpose, not randomly.
Tips.example: Position the sign where it's clearly visible to everyone.

Tips.title: Exactness Matters
Tips.description: The precise placement is often critical, especially in technical or design contexts.
Tips.example: Position the components according to the blueprint.

Condition.wordDefinition:
Condition refers to the state of something, such as its physical or mental state.

It can describe how healthy or well something is. For example, if a person has a cold, their condition may be described as "sick" or "unwell.".

Condition can be applicable in a variety of contexts, such as discussing the condition of a car, a piece of artwork, or the condition of someone's mental health.

Condition refers to the state of something, while position refers to its location or rank.

Function.wordDefinition:
Function and position are two different words that have different meanings and are applicable in different contexts.

Function refers to the purpose or role of something or someone. For example, the function of a heart is to pump blood throughout the body.

In computer programming, a function is a block of code that performs a specific task and can be called or executed when needed.

Function refers to purpose or role, while position refers to location or placement. Both words are applicable in various fields and contexts such as science, technology, sports, and everyday life.

Location.wordDefinition:
Location refers to a specific place, area or site where something or someone is situated. It conveys a general sense of the area where something or someone is positioned, but not the exact spot.

For example, a house's location could be in a suburban neighborhood.

Position refers to the exact spot or placement of something or someone. It conveys a specific sense of the location of an object or person in relation to a fixed point or surroundings.

Location is used when we talk about a general area where something or someone is situated, and position is used when we talk about the specific spot where something or someone is located.

Placement.wordDefinition:
Placement and position are similar words that can be used in various contexts, but they have slightly different meanings.

Placement typically refers to the act of placing something in a particular location or position.

It can also refer to the process of finding a suitable place for something or someone. For example, in the context of a job, a placement might refer to a temporary work assignment or internship.

In essence, placement pertains more to the action of putting something somewhere, while position pertains more to the status or location of something.

Posture.wordDefinition:
Posture refers to the way someone holds or carries their body, especially when sitting or standing.

Good posture means standing up straight with shoulders back and head held high.

Position is applicable in situations where we need to describe the location or status of something/someone, while posture is applicable when we need to describe how a person is holding their body.

Rank.wordDefinition:
Rank refers to a person's level of authority or importance compared to others in the organization or society. This can be in terms of titles like sergeant or captain in the military, or to a person's place on a hierarchy such as a corporate ladder or a social class.

Essentially, position refers to the specific role or job that a person has, while rank refers to the relative status or authority of a person compared to others.

Role.wordDefinition:
Role refers to the expected or typical behavior of a person in a particular situation or context.

It is not necessarily linked to a specific job or title, but more to the expectations of society or a group. For example, a person's role as a parent or a friend is based on social expectations and responsibilities.

Position refers to a specific job title or function within an organization, while role refers to the expected behavior or responsibilities of a person in a particular context.

Situation.wordDefinition:
Situation refers to the circumstances, conditions, or context in which something or someone exists or operates.

It can refer to a particular event or moment in time, or a more general state of affairs. For example, “the situation in the world is concerning right now” describes the current global conditions, whereas “the situation at the party got out of hand” refers to the events that occurred at a specific gathering.

Position refers to location or status, while situation refers to circumstances or conditions. Each word is applicable in different contexts depending on what is being described.

Stance.wordDefinition:
Stance refers to an individual's position or attitude toward something, typically a controversial issue or topic. It is more commonly used in discussions or debates regarding social, political, or economic issues.

Position refers to where something or someone is located, while stance refers to their point of view or opinion about something.

For example, a soccer goalkeeper's position is in front of the goalpost, while a political candidate's stance on taxes may be pro-business or pro-progressivity.

Stand.wordDefinition:
Position refers to a location or placement of something or someone in a physical sense, whereas stand refers to a belief or opinion about something.

However, if you are discussing your thoughts on a political issue, you would talk about your stand on the matter.

Position is used for physical placement, while stand is used for expressing beliefs or opinions.

Station.wordDefinition:
Station generally refers to a fixed location where someone or something is situated, such as a train or bus station.

It can also refer to a military base, TV or radio station, or a place where someone works, such as a police station or fire station.

Position mainly refers to the location of someone or something, either physically or in an organizational hierarchy, while station refers to a particular fixed location, often with a specific purpose to serve.

Status.wordDefinition:
In contrast, status refers to a person's level of social or professional standing in society.

It is often related to their wealth, education, or social class. For example, "He has a high social status because he comes from a wealthy family," or "Her celebrity status gives her access to exclusive events.".

Position is related to a person's specific job or location, while status is related to their social standing or level of prestige.

quotes.Text: It is very difficult for us to know we love somebody because it is an insecure position to be in. But in the end, it is important to be honest about your love because life is not that long.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Yoko Ono

quotes.Text: I'm not a type-B personality who knows I have a cancer growing inside of me and can live with the knowledge. I go into a kung-fu attack position when I go through the door of a hospital.
quotes.Title: American General
quotes.Name: Norman Schwarzkopf

quotes.Text: The easiest thing to be in the world is you. The most difficult thing to be is what other people want you to be. Don't let them put you in that position.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Leo Buscaglia

quotes.Text: Sadly, the truth is, there aren't many people who can be put in high positions who won't start thinking highly of themselves.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.Text: If you get a guy that can play a couple positions, it helps you out a real lot.
quotes.Title: American Baseball Player
quotes.Name: Yogi Berra

quotes.Text: Klopp helped me play my favourite position again - centre-forward.
quotes.Title: French Athlete
quotes.Name: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang

quotes.Text: If you are in a position to influence someone, you are a leader.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Sheri L. Dew

quotes.Text: I position everything else in my life around making movies.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Richard King

quotes.Text: I am in support of the NRA position on gun control.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: William J. Clinton

quotes.Text: Trequartista is an important position in the team.

quotes.Name: Roberto Mancini
